caption: Great. Beautiful, less crowded, clean, peaceful. Could easily spend hours here

Wonderful parc. You discover new scenery every time. We found la maison du jardinage inside, and it was beyond expectations since it was blooming. April/May are indeed the months to visit. You can either enjoy a stroll within the greenery, sculptures, or within the potage where you find different kinds of plants and you can learn about themü™¥

I wish Mandurah‚Äôs WA had some where like this that promoted all walks life, abilities, values, lifestyles. This place is buzzing and it‚Äôs 8pm on a Sunday in June, the sun doesn‚Äôt go down here until 10.30pm. Loving all that France has to offer
During night It was pretty scary for me, the area in near proximity of port de Bercy really does not look pleasantly, but more far away you are from that part the park is becoming nice and nicer.
It is one of the most beautiful parks and worth a visit at any time of the year.

The station was not neat and clean, especially the washroom. The worst part of the station was the washroom. I am totally dissatisfied. By the way, this is a very busy station. Buses come and go to EU countries from here almost every minute.
A beautiful safe park to relax in.  Wait out the transplant.  Lots of security.  Full international of passengers.  Everything is friendly

It wasn't clean at all when I arrived..But they cleaned it afterwards. Good place to wait until the bus arrives. Crowded always and the toilets are terrible inside the main bus Queue. But a good place to kill your time.  But the plus point is.. you can visit Parc de Bercy for free and there are toilets inside the jardin. A little bit creepy as it is not crowded at all.  üåø Exploring the Urban Oasis at Parc de Bercy! üå≥  üë´ Whether you're here with your partner or flying solo, Parc de Bercy is the ultimate escape from the city's hustle and bustle. Nestled in the heart of Paris, this park is a haven for nature lovers and those seeking a serene respite. Stroll hand in hand through the lush gardens, enjoy a picnic by the picturesque lake, or simply unwind under the shade of towering trees. It's the perfect spot to reconnect with nature and with each other. üçÉüíë  #ParcDeBercy #ParisianGetaway #NatureLovers #CityEscape #RomanticStrolls #UrbanOasis #PicnicParadise #TranquilRetreat #BreatheEasy #ParkLife #ParisAdventures #GreenEscape #LoveInBercy  Don't miss out on this charming urban oasis, where love and nature meet in perfect harmony. Parc de Bercy is a place to create unforgettable memories and celebrate the beauty of Parisian life. üíöüóº

Little bit scary but useble. I travlled from Belgium Mons to Paris, it was a good trip by flixbus. I missed my flixbus when ƒ± am trying to return Belgium. I have to buy a bus ticket from blablabus, it was a horrible experience.

Very cozy and well maintained park, open to the public. There are nice plants compositions, water ponds, pergoles with roses, wines, collections of other flowers and trees. If one is tired of concrete-glass and transport, here can find a shelter to admire nature and walking or just sitting on a bench.

Beautiful, peaceful. There are toilets the one I went to I paid ‚Ç¨1 but I think there are some free ones too. There's a cafe in the middle too. Plenty of seats to sit down on. I went in June on a very hot day.

Park quite okay. Bus station quite cold. Not too much seats available  to wait for buses. Sockets not enough.  The park has enough seats. There is also an area for exercising. A long stretch of stairs to also exercise on. Parc  has good scenery

This park is very unique not too classic nor traditional parisian one . It has a pond with ducks , a vineyard and structured plants and trees . Two kids playgrounds are available one is for younger ones , other is for older kids which is very creative and original in terms of games . It is practical for a stroll after having lunch in the village de bercy area . There is a bridge in the middle of it which is quite charming for a walk in the sun . They have grass area to chill on too .

Excellent green space for running, working, cycling even though there was a gym inside for more intense physical activities. In addition, there were several statues inside the park. It's a nice natural space to bring kids and puppies to play and train. Inside the park a huge bus station is available from where so many buses depart to different locations across Europe. Our Flix bus from Antwerp Central stopped here and returned us to our destination the next day.  Because of the bus stoppage the place is a little bit busy most of the time. Anyway, it was a good experience in the park.
It's a cute little park. Fun place to sit down and chill in. Do nothing for a while before getting on your bus

Nice place leading to the FluxBus and BlablaCar and other transport services providers‚Äò station. The park affords a green scenery and just on the side is the Cinematheque in black. In the corner somewhere when you are on the road are shops to grab something and you can return into the park. Good location! And oh I forgot to mention it has a physical exercise place!

Very huge and nice family friendly park that is adjacent to Bercy Bus Station. Full of duck-filled ponds and rows of trees which allow the sun's rays to seep through giving the park a unique lustre that is difficult to capture on camera or describe in words. If you want a serene place to escape from the Paris bustle, then this is it. Pets are allowed.
Ahahaha..so crowded.. just stay outside and enjoy the park, an hour before departure, then go in side the station.
Nice little park next to the long distance bus station. Good to spend some minutes before leaving or after arriving.
Just outside the bus stop üöå there is a park (free of charge) for calisthenicsü§∏. Good equipment üëå with cement weights üèãÔ∏èfor a quick workout üí™üèΩ before you go to Paris üòÅüòâ ‚Ä¶
Nice park but a little bit scary to walk around alone. Lots of dark and narrow paths.

Relatively pricey, yet very well dispatched and delicious food. I came here for breakfast and was very well attended by the personnel, who were very friendly and welcoming. The environment couldn't be nicer, as it has very big and nicely decorated areas making you feel like you're in a garden. Speaking of which, you have the option of sitting inside or outside in the patio, both of which are good choices, also with outdoor seating outside next to the nearby park.

Great large park with much to offer. The place honestly needs a little TLC and some maintenance efforts but overall a great place to spend time with family and relax in nature. Great calisthenics park as well (get here early, it‚Äôs gets busy by 7:30am).
It is a good bus station but the toilets are a disgrace. The men‚Äôs toilets were broken and had to use a filthy women‚Äôs toilet. More seats needed as the sitting area is cramped and smells.
Very beautiful park. It's even better than "les tuileries" or "le parc du Luxembourg". There are nice gardens and tall, refreshing trees. You find as well playgrounds, toilets and drinkable water.
Very nice park. Calm. With many flowers and trees. Very well maintained. Between Bercy Arena and Bercy Village.

The toilet was so so dirty. Should be looked after better... Every time I go there this thing never change.Specially it's dangerous for women and kid's health. Hope authority will take initiative to keep the toilet clean ....

This is a great park with 14 hectares to poke around. Lots of things for children to do and the Cour Saint Emilion(an expensive restaurant strip) is next door so you can get a drink or a meal afterwards or beforehand. There's a cinema next to the park as well. The park is however run down after 25 years. The lawns are worn out and need to be redone. Winter isn't the best season but it's still well worth the visit and the kids have a ball. Springtime and summer are the best seasons.
Very dirty place! No proper seating or clean toilets!! Looks very shaddy ! Though our bus were mapped to a parking no. And was displayed in info screens! But basic facilities
Most of the screens were you should find out we're your coach bay is didn't work or were stoping very often
Let's be honest, this isn't the hippiest place in Paris, it's rather dull and not really safe at night. It survives because of the bus traffic around!
Huge park, would be nice for picnic. Not far from Flixbus station.

Sat in the Gardin de Bercy waiting for a bus as the Bus Station was bad awful.  It's not just lower income people who use buses as I'm using for fun and it's an environmental form of travel....so please have the toilets improve (make sure you have paper),  Maybe a cafe in the park people can use to buy nice food until midnight which Paris could run so we have a nice choice of refreshments when waiting for our buses.  If you walk directly across the park there is a bar open to 22.00 to the right of the footpath in the cinema and to the left a very good little supermarket with great salad bar and all reasonably priced. Some bars further down street about 5 minutes from bus station Saw the famous rats....but it is paris and near the river.  Come on @flixbus get it improved
Pretty good park to empty your mind and enjoy the rest!
Creative green parc, with insect hotels and lots of flowers during summer. It has a monument and free toilet, with free available water. Perfect next to the Flixbus station.
Pleasant & well kept park, very relaxing & well shared in the great of summer. Ideal to chill, for a picnic, or for fleeting travel serenity before the chaos of the adjacent FlixBus Station!
Next to the train station and flix bus station It's big but you can visit nicer parks and sites in Paris
So many buses from another city and country. The public toilet are not recomended ü´† ‚Ä¶
